title: TOMORROW, 28 JAN! CODATA India National Committee and OT-ViRARe Task Group Event: FAIR and Reproducible Structural Biology
content: The upcoming workshop on “ FAIR and Reproducible Structural Biology: Methods, Workflows, and Assessment, ” brings together scientists, data experts, and policy communities to link AI for Science, FAIR data, reproducibility, and responsible research assessment. Convened under CODATA’s new Open Tools and Visitation Frameworks for Global Research Assessment Reform (OT-ViRARe) Task Group, this workshop is a thematic pre-event to the India AI Impact Summit , aiming to address How AI-drive
creator: Asha

title: Professor B. Burçak Başbuğ and Professor Virginia Murray appointed interim co-chairs of CODATA’s International Data Policy Committee
content: The CODATA Officers and Executive Committee are pleased to announce that Professor B. Burçak Başbuğ and Professor Virginia Murray have been appointed as interim co-chairs of the CODATA International Data Policy Committee (IDPC) . Burçak and Virginia are committed to advancing the work of the Data Policy in Times of Crisis (DPTC) collaboration with UNESCO, which has now reached an important stage: implementing and testing the recommendations contained in the UNESCO-CODATA Toolkit . They will also
creator: Asha

title: Call for Papers: Dataverse 2026 Annual Meeting from May 12th–15th, 2026, in Barcelona, Spain
content: The website is now live – https://dcm2026.com/ -, and we have opened the Call for Papers . We invite you to submit your abstract for a presentation or poster on the conference themes by January 29, 2026. Quick links to: – Important Dates and general information: https://dcm2026.com/general- information/ – Conference themes: https://dcm2026.com/ conference-themes/ – Abstract Submission: https://dcm2026.com/call-for- papers/ We look forward to seeing you in Barcelona on May
creator: Asha

title: Read Now – Disaster Risk Reduction and Open Data Newsletter: November and December 2025 Edition
content: Glaciers to Farms (G2F) Regional Program: Advancing Climate Resilience & Sustainable Development in Central and West Asia Glacier systems in the Pamir and Tien Shan ranges are retreating rapidly; projections indicate over 50 per cent of glacier volume could be lost by 2100. This cryosphere meltdown is disrupting water cycles, threatening the livelihoods and food security of over 340 million people across nine countries. Without urgent intervention, communities risk worsening poverty, displac
creator: Asha

title: Bridging Two Worlds: Reflections from the IDW2025 Panel on Research Data and Data Science
content: At IDW2025, a group of speakers from around the globe gathered to address a long-standing problem: although data is the common currency of both research data management and data science, the two communities often work in parallel worlds —each with its own conferences, training pipelines, infrastructures, and priorities. As Christine Kirkpatrick noted in her opening remarks, this separation persists despite converging challenges around stewardship, reproducibility, education, and ethics. She fram
creator: Asha

title: Read Now – November 2025: Publications in the Data Science Journal

creator: Asha

title: Webinar: Asia-Pacific: Advancing FAIR data in Advanced Networks
content: APAN and CODATA organised a webinar on 26th November to showcase the impact of the MoU between the two organisations announced on 20th November . This webinar will present the goals and activities of the two organisations and illustrate approaches to realising synergies between them. The webinar discussed the history of the collaboration, as well as the groups and activities identified as ideal candidates for further joint initiatives. These topics range from advanced data semantics and interope
creator: Asha

title: APAN and CODATA Join Forces to Promote Science, Research Data and Network-enabled Research to Address Global Challenges
content: The Asia Pacific Advance Network (APAN) and the Committee on Data of the International Science Council (CODATA) have formalised a strategic partnership through the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to underline their commitment to leveraging scientific discoveries and results to address global challenges, and to providing researchers with improved tools and resources to generate them. Simon Hodson, Executive Director of CODATA, and Markus Buchhorn, Advisor to the APAN Board and co-c
creator: Asha

title: Data Without Borders: Reflections from International Data Week 2025, Brisbane
content: By Bylhah Mugotitsa, Agnes Kiragga, Steve Cygu and Miranda Barasa, African Population and Health Research Center (APHRC). If there was ever a place where coffee, curiosity, and code met perfectly, it was International Data Week 2025 in Brisbane. You could feel the excitement from the minute you walked into the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre, the kind of energy that tells you something important is happening here. It wasn’t just about machine learning models or the latest frameworks; i
creator: Asha
